The Sage
Fear arises from the wind in the trees,
dust arises from the settled ground;
The uninhabited, unmoving,

original: etaṁ ve munidassanaṁ.🔽Yo jātamucchijja na ropayeyya,
analyzed: etam veḥ muni dassana  yaḥ jātam ucchijja na ropayeyya
translated: that is the vision of the sage.🔽One who, having cut off what is born, would not plant again,
would not seek out what is born,
they call him a sage who wanders alone,
the great seer has seen the state of peace.
Having measured the elements and the seed,
he would not seek out what is born,
he is a sage who sees the end of birth,
having abandoned speculation, he does not approach reckoning.
Having understood all the abodes,
he is not attached to any of them;
